a3feb242-453b-47c9-986d-e63971749ddb.description: Earners of this badge have developed and demonstrated skills and knowledge which make them job ready as a barista. This is a highly practical course facilitated by a professional barista and activities include simple coffee history and brewing methods, how coffee behaves as espresso, and how to steam perfect milk.
a3feb242-453b-47c9-986d-e63971749ddb.name: Barista Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate an understanding of coffee history and brewing methods
Demonstrate safe use of coffee machines and equipment
Make a range of coffees to suit a customer's needs

3222c243-0343-4c04-b220-5e8df0786cfa.description: Earners of this badge have developed and demonstrated protective behaviours and self-defence skills adaptable for a variety of scenarios. The MLC Personal protection workshop is facilitated by LIFE Martial Arts and empowers learners to feel safe and confident when faced with challenging situations by applying the ACT protocols (Assess/Awareness, Communicate, Transition) to develop situational awareness and control potentially dangerous situations.
3222c243-0343-4c04-b220-5e8df0786cfa.name: Personal Protection

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate the ability to correctly assess potential threats and formulate response options in scenario-based training activities
Demonstrate the ability to apply effective communication (verbal and non-verbal) in order to diffuse and deescalate confrontations in scenario-based training activities
Demonstrate the effective application of self-defence techniques in order to transition out of dangerous situations in scenario-based training activities

fe331a47-330c-4a1a-8986-474cd20936f6.description: Earners of this badge have developed introductory skills which enable them to communicate using Auslan (Australian Sign Language) and completed Deaf Awareness Training with an Auslan interpreter. This course is delivered by Access Plus (formerly known as the WA Deaf Society), who have over one hundred years of history advocating for and supporting the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community in Western Australia, and who continue to inspire countless West Australians to learn Auslan.
fe331a47-330c-4a1a-8986-474cd20936f6.name: Auslan

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate basic communication skills through Auslan (Australian Sign Language).
Demonstrate a sound grasp of key elements of deaf awareness training.

62f990fd-5ba3-4612-a268-4cb084e98af9.description: Earners of this badge hade developed and demonstrated an understanding of issues facing thousands of Australians every day and strategies and skills which empower them to make a difference to the lives of those less fortunate. Facilitated by The Salvation Army, this course engages learners with different community services and programs, engaging them in practical service activities at The Salvation Army's Heathridge Centre.
62f990fd-5ba3-4612-a268-4cb084e98af9.name: Service Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of learning workshops focussed on social issues in Australia, community service programs, and strategies which can be applied to make a positive impact on the lives of others.
Completion of active service at The Salvation Army's Heathridge Centre

218615b5-8a3e-458b-982b-9b07eeaf8c80.description: Earners of this badge have developed and demonstrated skills enabling them to have their voice heard in our community and across the world. They have developed and produced and recorded a TEd Talk styled presentation inspire empathy, awareness and action on an important social issue of their choosing.
218615b5-8a3e-458b-982b-9b07eeaf8c80.name: Videos For Change

badge_template_activities.title: The learner has produced an informative and emotive presentation based on a key social issue, displaying effective communication skills.
The learner has produced a well presented and effectively edited video to showcase their talk.

2a7178e9-87b9-411b-8981-26a18b106181.description: Earners of this badge have developed and demonstrated a range of life and self-management skills to make them more independent outside of the school environment. Create in response to a student commenting “I know what the mitochondria of a cell does, but not know how to read a contract or pay a bill!", this practical course explores how do I change a lightbulb, what Medicare is and why it matters, how to invest, what ‘I agree to the terms and conditions’ actually means, and more.
2a7178e9-87b9-411b-8981-26a18b106181.name: Adulting 101

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrates understand of key concepts and application of skills in challenges related to self-management strategies related to real life scenarios related to personal health, finances, and basic home maintenance tasks.

993b42eb-978f-4187-b429-004a89b1d073.description: Earners of this badge have developed and demonstrated skills which enable them to support students in their learning as an assistant to a professional classroom teacher. This experience offers the opportunity to work alongside a professional Junior Years Teacher from Methodist Ladies' College, gaining valuable insights into how teachers prepare for and teach classes, mark work, and support and empower their students to succeed and develop confidence, curiosity, and a lifelong love of learning.
993b42eb-978f-4187-b429-004a89b1d073.name: Teaching Assistant Cadet

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrates the ability to effectively aid a teacher in the classroom in organising, managing and delivering learning activities
Demonstrates the ability to support a small group of students in competing a structured learning activity (where appropriate)

96b6fb90-3084-4b4e-acc0-a3ff3199c750.description: Earners of this badge have developed and demonstrated first aid skills which meet the nationally recognised HLTAID011 Provide First Aid course standards. This course is facilitated by Surf Lifesaving WA providing a general grounding in first aid and will enables learners to perform appropriate first aid procedures and basic life support skills. This unit satisfies training requirements across a range of community and workplace settings.
96b6fb90-3084-4b4e-acc0-a3ff3199c750.name: First Aid - Surf Lifesaving WA

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrates appropriate decision making, strategies, and behaviour in responding to emergency situations, including recognising and assessment of situations, ensuring the safety of themselves, bystanders, and the casualty, and recognising potential psychological impacts on themselves and others.

Demonstrates effective application of first aid skills and strategies including cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) in line with Australian Resuscitation Council (ARC) guidelines and operating first aid equipment correctly in line with the manufacturer's instructions.

8bd08813-9d38-4439-90a3-6e0d5780fa95.description: Earners of this badge have developed and demonstrated the basic skills of coaching, particularly coaching children. They have gained an understanding of the basic theory through 8 online modules and have planned a short coaching session in a sport of their choice, which they put into practice by coaching a small group of junior years students.
8bd08813-9d38-4439-90a3-6e0d5780fa95.name: Community Coaching – Essential Skills (Level 0)

badge_template_activities.title: Achieved the online Community Coaching Essential Skills Course and downloaded their certificate
Planned a 20-minute coaching session for a group of 8 students, using the prescribed structure and principles
Delivered their coaching session successfully and received feedback on this from a mentor and peers
Observed, evaluated and provided feedback to peers on their coaching session

2402c854-1b2c-47df-87e2-e1f0f50572ad.description: Earners of this badge have developed an understanding of the theory behind the rules of volleyball and put this into practice in the role of a referee. They have achieved an official Volleyball WA refereeing accreditation which qualifies them to undertake voluntary or paid refereeing work.
2402c854-1b2c-47df-87e2-e1f0f50572ad.name: Volleyball Refereeing - Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of PBTR – Child Protection and Safeguarding (Online)
Successful completion of PBTR – Harassment and Discrimination (online)
Successful competion of Community Officiating – General principles Course (Online)
Successful completion of Level 1 Volleyball refereeing module (Online)
Demonstration of skills and capability in refereeing a volleyball match and receiving feedback on their performance
Observation, evaluation and provision of feedback to peers on their refereeing performance

1e80e120-5e7d-4f43-82f0-70cd6d22065a.description: Earners of this badge have developed and demonstrated the skills required to design, populate, and update a successful digital marketing website, and have gained real world experience in the digital space. Led by experts from both Rare Digital Marketing and the MLC Community and Engagement Office, focussing on the key skills needed to populate content, organise design blocks, and test web pages. They have successfully created websites to realise the brief of a real-world client.
1e80e120-5e7d-4f43-82f0-70cd6d22065a.name: Digital Marketing & Web Design

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrates the ability to understand and work to a brief to fulfill the needs of a client
Demonstrate the successful application of website design, development and testing skills
Demonstrate the ability to successfully populate content into the backend of a website
Demonstrates the ability to design and build a website from scratch

426d4f30-8400-43af-9e72-1a38452cded2.description: Earners of this badge have developed and demonstrated a range of skills based around starting and promoting a business, including finding brand development, website development, social media presence, and sales. This program is provided in partnership with BOP Industries and has been custom created for Methodist Ladies College.
426d4f30-8400-43af-9e72-1a38452cded2.name: Young Entrepreneurs Hub

badge_template_activities.title: The learner effectively identifies and develops a business and/or product idea.
The learner demonstrates and applies key website design and social media presence marketing principles.
The learner demonstrates the ability to identify customers and apply sales techniques in order to generate orders.

9ccae68e-5d6f-4a00-9fa4-746e6e738e5c.description: The Royal Life Saving Society Bronze Medallion is recognised as the minimum standard for a qualified lifesaver. Earners of this badge have developed and demonstrated personal survival skills and the knowledge and skills to develop the level of judgement, technique and physical ability required to safely carry out water rescues. It is suited to anyone who wishes to develop confidence to carry out water rescues in personal or work situations.
9ccae68e-5d6f-4a00-9fa4-746e6e738e5c.name: Bronze Medallion (Requalification)

badge_template_activities.title: Theory and or practical demonstration of resuscitation skills
Successful completion of a 400m (practice) swim, evenly distributed between freestyle, breaststroke, survival backstroke, and side stroke
Theory and or practical demonstration of entries and exits from the water, rescues, non-contact / contact / timed tows, search patterns, and rescue scenarios
Successful completion of a theory test consisting of 21 multiple choice questions and 9 written response questions.

c2759014-f6c0-4176-acf1-bbe3e847c4ab.description: Earners of this badge have developed and demonstrated skills which allow them to create items in clay using a pottery wheel. They have shown an understanding of the various stages of the ceramic process. They have produced their own item, managing waste, optimising aesthetics, and building trouble shooting responses to common errors and problems involved in the process. This course is facilitated by a specialist art teacher and expert in ceramics.
c2759014-f6c0-4176-acf1-bbe3e847c4ab.name: Pottery: Throwing on the Wheel

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrates the ability to centre clay on a wheel
Creates an aesthetically pleasing and stable vessel (such as a coffee mug)
Demonstrates effective use of a range of trouble shooting strategies and skills associated with the ceramic process

8758ba3e-aa97-479f-b6a6-a6be2e0c9aef.description: Earners of the Work Ready credential have developed 21st Century skills which are transferrable in their pursuit of employment or further education. These include teamwork, effective communication, journey planning, and personal styling. They have completed two days of learning, participating in guest speaker presentations and workshops by industry leaders and employers such as McDonalds, educational institutions and organisations, such as FEC and South Metro TAFE, Fremantle.
8758ba3e-aa97-479f-b6a6-a6be2e0c9aef.name: Work Ready

badge_template_activities.title: Work Ready Scavenger hunt: Complete the Work Ready Scavenger Hunt at Claremont Quarter to demonstrate learning and understanding.
Navigate the Transperth website to determine how to get to FEC, one of our VET partners, in Fremantle using public transport.
Participate in an InstepWest presentation about work placement, work health and safety and expectations of employers.
Participate in a communication presentation by a Trainer at FEC and South Metro TAFE in Fremantle.
Participate in a Job Ready presentation by McDonalds on the skills 21st Century employers want and how to gain employment.
Participate in a presentation from a leading stylist about what to wear at work, including a makeup and hair tutorial.

c7da7a3d-a45f-47ac-a26e-34b0915db4e7.description: Earners of this course have developed and demonstrated foundational data analysis skills, including data literacy, designing user interfaces, and cybersecurity. Specifically designed and led by expert academics at Curtain University, this course is aimed at learners who are pursuing related tertiary education courses, and challenges them through hands-on activities to solve 'wicked problems' in Curtain Universities innovative learning spaces: Management Decision Headquarters and The Agency.
c7da7a3d-a45f-47ac-a26e-34b0915db4e7.name: Data Analytics: Insights and Ideas

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of learning activities and challenges based on Data Literacy for the Data Phobic, Geospatial Data Analytics: Understanding Human Behaviour Through Location Data, Social Media Analytics: Understanding Digital Consumers, Designing Digital User Experiences, and Cybersecurity: Protecting yourself and others

8c9d9f22-c0ac-4971-865c-7dbda26b4b0d.description: Earners of this badge have developed and demonstrated the skills required to apply Design Thinking methodologies to business problems to uncover solutions. This interactive Curtain Business School experience sees learners redevelop a local site into a sustainable tourism hotspot using Design Thinking Methodologies, develop critical thinking, networking, and reflection strategies. It is aimed at learners who intend to take a university post school pathway.
8c9d9f22-c0ac-4971-865c-7dbda26b4b0d.name: Design Thinking Methodologies

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstration of Design Thinking Methodologies to develop a solution where a local site is transformed into a tourism hotspot
Effective presentation of their solution to a Board of Executives

69b5fb38-97e6-4ffc-b455-3f829a52a054.description: This course provides participants with the skills and knowledge required to provide a first aid response to a casualty in line with first aid guidelines determined by the Australian Resuscitation Council (ARC) and other Australian national peak clinical bodies. The unit applies to all persons who may be required to provide a first aid response in a range of situations, including community and workplace settings.
69b5fb38-97e6-4ffc-b455-3f829a52a054.name: Provide First Aid (HLTAID011)

badge_template_activities.title: Recognise and assess an emergency situation.
Ensure safety for self, bystanders and casualty.
Assess the casualty and recognise the need for first aid response.
Seek assistance from emergency services.
Perform cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) in accordance ARC guidelines.
Provide first aid in accordance with established first aid principles.
Display respectful behaviour towards casualty.
Obtain consent from casualty where possible.
Use available resources and equipment to make the casualty as comfortable as possible.
Operate first aid equipment according to manufacturers’ instructions.
Monitor the casualty’s condition and respond in accordance with first aid principles.
Accurately convey incident details to emergency services.
Report details of incident in line with appropriate workplace or site procedures.
Complete applicable workplace or site documentation, including incident report form.
Maintain privacy and confidentiality of information in line with statutory or organisational policies.
Recognise the possible psychological impacts on self and other rescuers and seek help when required.
Contribute to a review of the first aid response as required.

6437ccb0-e084-4e1c-ae04-d2c5a95c9f2f.description: Earners of this badge have developed and demonstrated the skills and strategies required to build a strong, positive and authentic self-connection, forming healthy beliefs around self-image and positive health practices. With an emphasis on each of us climbing our own, unique mountain, this workshop supports learners in moving from surviving to thriving. The course focusses on goal setting based on personal values and self-compassion/body image.
6437ccb0-e084-4e1c-ae04-d2c5a95c9f2f.name: Dash Health Hub

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrates an understanding of positive self-image and health practices and can apply them to their own individual situation
Demonstrates the ability to set effective goals for themselves, based on personal values and self-compassion and body image

bc82ac76-2feb-4866-bc2e-1a45d9d784f0.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the Communication module of the Walton Leadership Institute's Intermediate course at Methodist Ladies' College. They have developed and demonstrated mastery of efficient two-way communication skills. They can confidently present information to others and are capable active listeners. They have reflected on their performance in conducting interviews and planned and implemented improvements.
bc82ac76-2feb-4866-bc2e-1a45d9d784f0.name: The Walton Leadership Institute - Communication

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate an understanding of the elements of communication, including active listening and interviewing others through completion of a series of theory tasks.
Plan and conduct an interview, using the interviewees responses to guide follow-up questions.
Reflect on their performance in terms of active listening and two-way communication and implementing improvements in a second interview.

7ad1caf4-a17a-4ccd-97bc-428106567b6e.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the Enterprise module of the Walton Leadership Institute's Intermediate course at Methodist Ladies' College. They have developed and demonstrated the ability to take personal responsibility as a leader and to engender trust. They can set deadlines and expected outcomes for tasks they will undertake and apply strategies to adjust for obstacles or change. They have reflected on their own level of personal responsibility in their actions.
7ad1caf4-a17a-4ccd-97bc-428106567b6e.name: The Walton Leadership Institute - Enterprise

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate the ability to set personal deadlines and outcomes for a series of tasks.
Reflect on their ability to meet deadlines and expected outcomes for a series of selected tasks, as well as how they adjusted their approach to respond to obstacles and change.

975cc4eb-558e-4fe5-8ffc-6c018457c502.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the Exercising Judgement module of the Walton Leadership Institute's Intermediate course at Methodist Ladies' College. They have developed and demonstrated skills which enableto better understand their own behaviour and that of those around them. They understand the need to stand up for other and how they can act as a good role model for others. They have reflected on their core values and how they can protect others as a leader.
975cc4eb-558e-4fe5-8ffc-6c018457c502.name: The Walton Leadership Institute - Exercising Judgement

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate a clear understanding of their own core values as a leader through introspection exercises.

Demonstrate the understanding that they have a role as a leader to protect others and respond to situations in line with this responsibility. This is assessed through their response to a number of scenario-based exercises.
Reflect on their core values, how this will support them as a leader, and how they can use their platform as a leader to protect others.

40a33d51-ef47-4f8d-942f-4f1da26f6cca.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the Global Citizenship module of the Walton Leadership Institute's Intermediate course at Methodist Ladies' College. They have developed and demonstrated an understanding how global influences contribute to their personality, history, and culture. They are open and curious in their engagement with their own culture and others. They reflect on the importance of these cultures in shaping their own lives and that of their families and communities.
40a33d51-ef47-4f8d-942f-4f1da26f6cca.name: The Walton Leadership Institute - Global Citizenship

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate the ability to identify opportunities to serve others and actions to implement to create a positive outcome.
Reflect on the actions they have implemented to help others and the outcomes of those actions.

7659044b-7b8b-44e2-8000-ab2edf4edc23.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the Influencing Others module of the Walton Leadership Institute's Intermediate course at Methodist Ladies' College. They have developed and demonstrated skills which enable them as resilient, positive, and empathetic leaders. They can tailor and reframe language in order to promote a positive mindset in others. They have reflected on how their own attitude, energy, and language will influence others and how to optimise this influence.
7659044b-7b8b-44e2-8000-ab2edf4edc23.name: The Walton Leadership Institute - Influencing Others

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate the ability to use language to reframe situations in a positive way.
Demonstrate the ability to build an understanding of others through empathy, creating an effective empathy map and journal.
Reflect on how they can develop as positive leaders and plan specific actions they can implement to realise this.

471d7ad6-baec-48fa-9352-1058030006f2.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed all seven modules of the Walton Leadership Institute's Advanced course at Methodist Ladies' College. They have developed and demonstrated skills and understandings which make them an effective leader in areas such as communication, influencing others, exercising judgement, negotiating, enterprise, service, and global citizenship.
471d7ad6-baec-48fa-9352-1058030006f2.name: The Walton Leadership Institute - Leadership (Advanced)

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all seven modules of the Walton Leadership Institute (Methodist Ladies' College) Advanced Leadership course.

f63931e6-4d39-4639-8dbc-1c1fcc7638ac.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed all seven modules of the Walton Leadership Institute's Foundation course at Methodist Ladies' College. They have developed and demonstrated skills and understandings which make them an effective leader in areas such as communication, influencing others, exercising judgement, negotiating, enterprise, service, and global citizenship.
f63931e6-4d39-4639-8dbc-1c1fcc7638ac.name: The Walton Leadership Institute - Leadership (Foundation)

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all seven modules of the Walton Leadership Institute (Methodist Ladies' College) Foundation Leadership course.

e308d8bb-c92f-4291-8da5-b2bc621f4f0a.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed all seven modules of the Walton Leadership Institute's Intermediate course at Methodist Ladies' College. They have developed and demonstrated skills and understandings which make them an effective leader in areas such as communication, influencing others, exercising judgement, negotiating, enterprise, service, and global citizenship.
e308d8bb-c92f-4291-8da5-b2bc621f4f0a.name: The Walton Leadership Institute - Leadership (Intermediate)

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all seven modules of the Walton Leadership Institute (Methodist Ladies' College) Intermediate Leadership course.

27966ea6-3809-494c-9cd9-42aa402daf30.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the Negotiating module of the Walton Leadership Institute's Intermediate course at Methodist Ladies' College. They have developed and demonstrated skills which enable them to build trust through effective and active listening. They can apply these skills to resolve conflict and foster a culture of respect. They have reflected on their responses to a set of real-world scenarios and how to create positive outcomes through encouragement and advice.
27966ea6-3809-494c-9cd9-42aa402daf30.name: The Walton Leadership Institute - Negotiating

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate effective active listening skills by creating representations of scenarios presented as audio files.

Reflect in a voice journal on challenges they have faced and how they might respond differently to similar situations in the future. Offer encouragement and feedback to others based on their similar reflections.

7f9909f4-7d3a-46e7-8487-d1210d66f5dc.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the Service module of the Walton Leadership Institute's Intermediate course at Methodist Ladies' College. They have developed and demonstrated an understanding of the importance of helping others and how kindness and respect can make a positive difference to the lives of others. They identify specific actions which they can implement to help others and implement them. They reflect on the impact of their actions.
7f9909f4-7d3a-46e7-8487-d1210d66f5dc.name: The Walton Leadership Institute - Service

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate the ability to identify opportunities to serve others and actions to implement to create a positive outcome.
Reflect on the actions they have implemented to help others and the outcomes of those actions.
